result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon L Zepeda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)4.
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as recommended.  

AODA and follow up. 

DNA sample.

Case Called: 9:02 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Julianne Lennon.
Both parties have received a PSI Report. Parties state corrections to be made on the PSI. 
State makes sentencing arguments.
Defense makes sentencing arguments. 
Defendant makes statement. 
OTR- 9:34 am
BOTR- 9:44 am
Court addresses the Defendant. 
COURT ORDERS:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g)-Second or Subsequent Offense)>> 7 Years WSPS, 2 Years IC and 5 Years ES, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds 202 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP Programming, but not CIP Programming.

Ct. 3 (Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g)-Second or Subsequent Offense)>> 7 Years WSPS, 2 Years IC and 5 Years ES, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds 202 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP Programming, but not CIP Programming.

Ct. 4 (Possess w/Intent-THC (>=200 grams)-Second or Subsequent Offense)>> 3.5 Years WSPS, 1.5 Years IC and 2 Years ES, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds 202 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP Programming, but not CIP Programming.

Ct. 5 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place-Second and Subsequent Offense)>> 3.5 Years WSPS, 1.5 Years IC and 2 Years ES, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds 202 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP Programming, but not CIP Programming.

Parties are to keep the PSI Reports- PSI Reports are to Remain CONFIDENTIAL.
Letters are CONFIDENTIAL.
DEFENDANT REMANDED TO WSPS.
